section.title: Project Properties
section.para: This dialog is accessible by selecting in the menu.

section.title: Languages
section.para: You can either enter the source and target languages by hand, or use the drop down menus. Bear in mind that changing the languages of an active project may render the existing translation memories useless since their language pair may no longer match the new languages.
Tokenizers corresponding to the selected languages are displayed.

listitem.para: Sentence-level segmentation splits the source files contents in segments based on the rules defined in . The rules can be modified using regular expressions. See for details.
Leave the box unchecked if you prefer not to segment the text (or, more specifically, segment it a the paragraph).

Changing this setting during a translation does not modify the segmentation of already existing translation memories. Switching from sentence to paragraph segmentation mid-translation will not change the internal translation memory of the project. (OmegaT may upgrade old translation memories that did not use sentence segmentation, but not vice versa) However, OmegaT will attempt to create fuzzy matches for paragraphs by combining existing sentence translations.

warning.para: Changing the segmentation settings may split or merge some already translated segments. This will effectively return them to the "untranslated" status, as they will no longer match segments recorded in the project memory, even though their original translation is still there.

listitem.para: If there are non-unique segments in the source documents, checking this option will set the first translated segment as the default translation and automatically use the same target text in the remaining repeated segments.
You can use to assign an alternative translation to segments that require a different translation.
If not checked, all segments can be assigned a different translation.

If checked, no formatting (inline) tags will be displayed in the source segments. This is especially useful when dealing with texts where inline formatting is not particularly useful (e.g., OCRed PDF, or poorly converted .odt or .docx files.)

note.para: The tags are not really removed from the document, but rather stacked at the end of the segment. In most cases, this should not keep the translated file from opening.

listitem.para: This area allows you to enter an external post-processing command (a script to rename files, for instance) that will be applied each time is used. Calling a script is recommended because the external command does not allow the use of pipes or similar features.
Segmentation rules are generally valid across all projects and found in in the .

The user, however, may need to generate a set of rules specific to the current project. Use this button to open the Project Specific Segmentation Setup dialog. Check the Make the segmentation rules project specific box, and adjust the segmentation rules as desired.
The new set of rules will be stored in the file of the folder of the project and will supersede the general set of segmentation rules.

note.para: To delete project specific segmentation rules, uncheck the box or remove that file.

warning.para: The options displayed in or are always the general options and never the project specific options.
If you have project specific settings, any modifications you make to the same settings from those will not be taken into account.

section.title: File locations
section.para: An OmegaT translation project consists of a folder hierarchy that contains the resources used in the translation. The location of these folders is predefined, but can be modified here. Keep in mind that modify the project folders will not move existing files from the old location to the new one.
The location of all resources is stored in the file of the .
Click on Exclusions... to define the files or folders that will be ignored by OmegaT. An ignored file or folder:

listitem.para: is not displayed in the pane,
is not taken into account in the window, and
is not copied to the folder when the translated files are created.

section.para: The Exclusion patterns dialog, allows you to add or remove a pattern, or to edit one by double-clicking it, or selecting it and pressing F2. You can use wildcards that follow the Apache ant syntax.
